meanings.definition: The act of reacting in response to a previous action.
meanings.sent1: Her retroactions to his comments were always thoughtful and considerate.
meanings.sent2: The retroactions of the audience were positive after the speaker's inspiring speech.
meanings.sent3: The retroactions of the puppy to the new toy were adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: His retroactions to the challenging situation were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The retroactions of the plants to the sunlight were visible in their growth.

meanings.definition: The influence or effect of a past event on a current situation.
meanings.sent1: The retroactions of history can be seen in the architecture of the city.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the retroactions of her childhood experiences shaping her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The retroactions of the old recipe on the new dish were surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The retroactions of the storm were felt in the calmness that followed.
meanings.sent5: The retroactions of his mentor's advice guided him through tough times.
